definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])

sentences.english: There are some times when kids are abducted.
sentences.chinese: 但有些时候小孩子会被诱拐。

sentences.english: Armed robbery and abduction have been on the increase countrywide.
sentences.chinese: 持械抢劫和诱拐案的案发率在全国范围内都有所上升。

sentences.english: The Buttah are normally associated with nightmares, abductions and the taking of small children.
sentences.chinese: 饿鬼通过与恶梦在一起，诱拐和吸引小孩。

sentences.english: He had attempted to abduct the two children.
sentences.chinese: 他曾企图诱拐这两名儿童。

sentences.english: Lightman: We need her to name her abductor , right?
sentences.chinese: 我们得要她说出诱拐者的名字，对吧？

sentences.english: And why is he willing to use his own son to abduct them?
sentences.chinese: 为什么他愿意利用亲生儿子来诱拐女人？

sentences.english: An abductor can then call them by name.
Lancelot killed several of his fellow knights after they found him with the queen.
sentences.chinese: 朗斯洛还杀死了几个反对他诱拐王后的骑士。

sentences.english: He had attempted to abduct the three boys.
sentences.chinese: 他曾企图诱拐那三个男孩。

sentences.english: The word plagiarism has been derived from the Latin word "plagiarius", which means a kidnapper.
sentences.chinese: 剽窃词语源于拉丁文，意为诱拐者。

sentences.english: The police balked the attempt to kidnap the child.
sentences.chinese: 警方挫败了诱拐小孩的企图。

sentences.english: I can indict you for abducting high school student.
sentences.chinese: 我可以告你诱拐中学生。

sentences.english: And abducts himself to the beloved catacombs and vaults.
sentences.chinese: 并把他诱拐，带到亲爱的地下陵寝。

definition: human trafficking/to abduct and sell/to kidnap and sell
